p: Diabetes mellitus (DM) is a chronic metabolic disorder characterized by elevated blood glucose levels as a result of the impaired secretion of insulin/insulin insensitivity. 1 The progression of DM has been growing worldwide from 108 million by 1980 to 463 million by 2019 with 1.6 million deaths in 2016 accredited to them worldwide, estimated to increase to 578 million (10.2%) by 2030 and 700 million by 2045. 2 According to the WHO, about 80% of the population is using herbal medicines in the aim of treating several diseases, 3 and gaining growing attention in global healthcare debates. 4
